website_summaries.verdict: A low-priced steam producer that's ideal for rooms, but not  for anyone who wants a smaller, personal inhaler.
pros: Features a medicine cup and nightlight
Produces steam for up to 24 hours thanks to the 1.5 gallon capacity
cons: Not designed for the direct inhalation of steam

customer_reviews.title: People - Please read the manual...
customer_reviews.text: Had 3 of these going on four years and they work beautifully when you operate them correctly. If it isn't humidifying, you have to put a pinch of salt to it. The manual suggests 1/8 tsp but I've had better luck with slightly more. If it is making a bubbling or gurgling sound, you have to clean the unit out. *No* humidifier is intended to work indefinitely without cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: Talagand

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!!
customer_reviews.text: Its junk in my opinion. Clogged up after a weeks worth of use and will not work. I bought 3 of them and they all did the same thing. Looked up humidifiers on consumer reports and they recommended the cvs brand model GUL540V1 and i bought three of them and they work excellent. Go to CVS and buy their brand. Don’t buy this Vicks brand in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: kevin ward

customer_reviews.title: Awful!
customer_reviews.text: It does not work - does not produce any steam and adding salt does not work. When I tried to return I was informed it is not eligible for a refund. I'd say save your money or go for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Xenia Kole

customer_reviews.title: This was a BIG waste of $$$$
customer_reviews.text: This was a BIG waste of $$$$. We are elderly and $$$ conscious and bought this as Vicks has a pretty good name We have used this nightly for about 15 days and over the days it got worse and worse. The light is barely working now and either spurts a cluster of water smoke or non at all and it makes noises like Put Put putput PUT!~! Hubby said it cannot be safe for this to happen. Poster wrote that Amazon will not take this back. How sad. This will be my last item I buy from them. Y0o would think that Vicks would make a better product. Read the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: MariCarrie

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: My home has hard water and we kept having issues with cool mist humidifiers. I bought one of these vaporizers and am pretty satisfied. My only issue is that a full tank of water only lasts 6-7 hours; not the 18-24 hours that is in the product description. I wish that I could get 12 hours out of it since I use it when my kids are sick and congested.
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL J.

customer_reviews.title: Great humidifier. Semi-difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.text: These are great, cheap humidifiers. They use electric vaporization, which means they will keep pushing moisture into the air no matter how saturated (watch out for condensation on windows), and there are no filters to clean. Only complaint is that the reservoir is designed such that there is no easy way to get dirty water out of it. Water gets dirty after a few cycles with scaling from tap water. Pros: - cheap - effective - quiet Con: - Difficult to empty dirty water. Takes a lot of shaking and results in a bit of a mess around the kitchen sink.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Gold

customer_reviews.title: Vicks used to make a good product......
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. First of all very little of the liquid vapo steam evaporates when added to top of unit. Then a few weeks after I started using them one boils water out the steam vents. ( I did not overfill) Then yesterday one of them did not shut off automatically like it's supposed to and when I came home there was a burning smell in my house. It was the vaporizer
customer_reviews.author: Greg G.

customer_reviews.title: Throws a truckload of steam!!
customer_reviews.text: Got a $45 dollar model also by Vicks, the tower model (which I confess looks much better and sits more easily on furniture) but this one?? Out performs it hands down. Yes you certainly may need a pinch of salt, up to half a teaspoon. When I want less steam, less it no salt. When I want what amounts to a sauna, half a teaspoon it is!! Love it so much I bought a second one a week later!
customer_reviews.author: Momma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to fight the flu
customer_reviews.text: This helped me stop coughing so bad at night. Easy clean up and set up. I like that you can add the vapo pads or the inhalant. It has slots for both. My bedroom is fairly large and it covers a wide area. The night light isn't too bright but enough so you know where it is. No switches, just plug it up and leave it. Helped moisturize my nasal cavities that were bleeding from me having to constantly blow my nose. It also helped calm the constant coughing from the strangling feeling of the flu in my throat.
customer_reviews.author: Rolltidelady334

customer_reviews.title: Low maintenance, healthy choice
customer_reviews.text: Use every night. Had this one on since the heater has been on this winter (about 2 months now) Had same brand previous and lasted many years. It does have black bits from how device functions but is normal. When I first received it did not produce much vapor (or black bits) added pinch of salt only once & works great. Depends on your water how it will produce/how long it goes on a gallon. I prefer this type of device because of low maitanance /no changing filters or routine tank cleaning. I also prefer due to the water being boiled prior because the air released from these vaporizers will be free from contamination.
customer_reviews.author: teeg

customer_reviews.title: I Love This...
customer_reviews.text: I had a humidifier that consisted of, oh, at least 5 separate pieces. Every time I cleaned it I had to take it apart, soak this and that, scrub it down etc. This is two pieces. Filled it, plugged it in, nice steady steam. In reading all the negative reviews, it's interesting to note that most of the issues in those reviews are addressed in the manual, as well as how to fix them. It is imperative that you read the manual. I am very happy with this very simple, inexpensive device.
customer_reviews.author: wdon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Bedroom
customer_reviews.text: You won't see any white powder with these. No need to clean it. Needs to be paired with a hygrometer that acts as a switch - amazon sells them. You can move the probe around away from the humidifier so you get a true level where you want it and it goes on and off instead of needlessly running constantly. When this fails in a year or two maybe longer you just buy another one for $15. The hygrometer will likely last for years and years. It's too bad they don't sell the heating element for say $8 because you don't need to replace the reservoir and its bulky to ship etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: Do not use overnight!!
customer_reviews.text: First night of use-woke up to the smell of burning plastic! Into the garbage it went!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly & Jason

customer_reviews.title: Faulty and Stuck
customer_reviews.text: Horrible waste of money. Every single time we plugged this is, it tripped the breaker in my house. Tried 3 different outlets in 3 different rooms. The cord got very warm after being plugged in for 10 seconds, just long enough to trip the breaker. The worst part is, this item isn’t eligible for return or replacement so we just wasted money. What a horrible, horrible policy. Basically stolen money. Absolutely do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joker's Laugh

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth $15
customer_reviews.text: It works well for about 6 hours before the water reaches the minimum level for it to run, even though it is still pretty full. So it has about a 6 hour max instead of 18-24 hours. The night light is BRIGHT. Covered it with electrical tape and it is still very noticeable. The water turns black after running it. I’m assuming it’s coming from the black plastic that houses the heating elements. It’s gross and I don’t like the idea of putting that black water into the air.
customer_reviews.author: Natalee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last as long as advertised, but the diffuser dish rocks.
customer_reviews.text: There is always a good amount of water left in the bottom that the vaporizer just can't suck up. So this lasts 3-6 hours for me, depending on how hard it's pumping steam out (which just depends on how hard our tap water is). So while it doesn't last as long as advertised, I love the auto shut-off and the diffuser dish. I put thieves essential oil in here on a regular basis and LOVE it. I also use menthol essential oil when I need it for a cold, and just plain tea tree oil when I'm cleaning and need to add some moisture to the air.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Nowariak

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive humidifier but you get what you pay for. Humidifier has a large tub design that fits a lot of water, however, the humidifier can't reach the water at the bottom of the tub. The unit also leaves black particles in the remaining water - this started pretty much from first use. The tub has an awkward design that makes it difficult to pour all of the water out which makes it difficult to clear the tub of the black particles. Lastly, the unit doesn't produce much steam unless you add salt.
customer_reviews.author: Musicman132

customer_reviews.title: Perfect humidifier.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for a while now and it's perfect. It doesn't get mold or build up like our cool mist did. It pumps out steam and lasts all night (sometimes two nights) without running out of water. It would probably last about 24 hours before needing a refill if you left it running continuously. It's super affordable and does it's job. I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Get's that hot steamy H2O right into the air.
customer_reviews.text: I've got two of these bad boys going in my room at once. It's like a tropical rainforest up in here. A tropical rainforest for sipping so much tea and lemon juice and getting over bronchitis. Thanks for helping me breathe friend.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca Dillard

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective - not eligible for returns
customer_reviews.text: The heating element does not get hot. And apparently this item cannot be returned. So now I got the thing and have to call in the warranty. I regret not spending a bit more on something better.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE UNLESS YOUR OK WITH A TOTAL LOSS AND POSSIBLY PROPERTY DAMAGE
customer_reviews.text: This thing is over heating throwing water all over the place and tripping breakers. It had burnt my wooden table top and ruined the surface in about a 2 foot diameter. This item aperently cannot be returned because it contains flamable liquid or hazordous materials. Last i checked water is not flamable or a hazardous material. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS IF YOU WANT TO BE ABLE TO REPLACE IT IF IT IS BROKEN ! Very upset, terrible return policy. Seems like there selling returns and not sure if there good or not so there not allowing returns.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love how simple this is to use, although there’s a little bit of a learning curve at first. You definitely have to read and follow the directions in order for it to work properly. It holds a good amount of water and I feel like it works better at humidifying the air than our other expensive Crane humidifier. The light on it is very bright, but I still like it there to indicate that it’s on. However, it did take the finish off of the wooden end table that I had it sitting on. I guess that was just user error though. I didn’t realize the bottom of it would get that hot.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth $8
customer_reviews.text: As much as I hate to waste things, I threw this away. No matter how much I soaked and scrubbed the attachment, the black plastic always turned the water black. Also it only lasted a few hours because it stopped working once the container got half empty. Others suggested adding salt to help but that never worked. Although doable my other two lesser complaints are that it the constant bubbling noise was noisy and it doesnt actually latch or lock when put together.
customer_reviews.author: T. Rexroth

customer_reviews.title: Basic and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: Had it a few weeks and does the job. I wish it had a switch to turn off and on. If it is plugged in, it is on. There is a sensor to auto shut off when the water gets low. Twice it had turned off when the tank was half full. I don't know if it was too hot, or maybe the minerals in my water caused some buildup and tripped the sensor. I like the slots to add the "vapo pads". It came with a free sample and they gave off a soothing menthol scent as they were warmed by the steam.
customer_reviews.author: ylime85

customer_reviews.title: works but it's weird
customer_reviews.text: This thing is odd. When we first got it it lasted about four hours on a full tank, now it lasts all night but the flow isn't as strong. Have to regularly clean it out and it's a bit messy and a pain to refill every night. But for the price it works and seems to really humidify the air and you can add the Vicks scents (or essential oils) and that is nice when you're sick.
customer_reviews.author: A. F. Butchart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect !!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality and a great price for this. Much bigger then I expected it to be. The top of the lid has dual scent pad slots for the Vicks pads to be inserted and it also has a Vicks medicine slot for the liquid to go. There's a nightlight on the top as well. Gives off a decent amount of steam. Very happy with this product and it came just in time because we're all sick!
customer_reviews.author: Jestcy

customer_reviews.title: Crackling noise while running
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with how noisy this is. I can handle a bit of fan noise, but this thing has a sort of crackling noise. I bought this to use the vapor oil stuff, so I keep it close to my head during the night. Drives me nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Jason N.

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: We live in a climate where I need to run humidifiers constantly in the winter or we will all have nose bleeds. I have this one and 2 others. This one is by far the most annoying. I always have to put salt in it for it to work. My suggestion would be to spend a little more for a better humidifier.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Schavrien

customer_reviews.title: Simple and sanitary
customer_reviews.text: This produces steam by boiling water. That kills any germs that may grow in the water. Other humidifiers, if not cleaned well, can distribute any germs in the water into the air. It does consume a lot of electricity compared to other humidifiers. It takes more energy to boil water vs just running a fan. But it's worth it in my opinion for the simple operation, and fact that even if you forget to clean it properly, the steam this makes is still safe and won't spread mold/bacteria into the air.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Ranta

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Bought in October 2018. Here we are in January 2019 , the device is dead. Nothing reviving it. No light, no steam , nada. This thing does NOT shut itself off, no matter the (false) advertisement that it does Less than 3 months, no matter how much you paid for the product, not worth it
customer_reviews.author: T. Whiting

customer_reviews.title: It is inexpensive for a reason
customer_reviews.text: This products stinks, plain and simple. I used this vaporizer in a medium sized room, definitely NOT a large space, and it did absolutely nothing at all. You couldn't even tell I had it on. I left it running in the room with the door shut for a few hours and I still couldn't tell a noticeable difference. In this instance you get what you pay for, I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer DiMambro

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money !!
customer_reviews.text: Well it works well when it's working correctly. Once it gets dirty and after a few uses it sucks. The money I saved in purchasing it I spent on the vapor pads, and distilled water and salt. We don't even have hard water but within a week I had to take it apart and clean the heating elements. When using the vapor liquid it sputters like it's clogged so I take it apart and clean it out again. I'm already looking for a different one and regret spending any money on this one. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Marenger

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!! - Product can damage your Wood Floors, Black Residue always found in tank
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE!! - WILL NOT ACCEPT RETURNS OR REFUNDS - It does not work - does not produce any steam and adding salt does not work. The product leaves a black residue in the tank & can damage your wood floors. You best bet is to clean unit and resell it on Ebay.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Monson

customer_reviews.title: Easiest and cleanest option to provide moisture to room
customer_reviews.text: Love this product so much better than other humidifiers I've tried. No mold building up, no filters - just pure clean vapor into the air. We have hard water so no trouble getting it to steam. Works perfect and easy to refill and clean. Don't believe reviews that say steam humidifiers aren't as good for allergies. Pure nonsense. My son has very bad allergies and this product keeps his nose healthy all winter long. Also no mold building up like in those cool and warm mist humidifiers.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Less than year stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 1/28/18 and it already stopped working. I did not use it every day, probably less that 20 days total in that time. It is not easy to clean, and almost impossible to pour all of the water out. The opening is not that small but the way the bottom is shaped creates an issue. I loved it when it worked. Sad that it is so poorly made and designed that it did not last 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: College Kid

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS!!! It runs so hot I thought the carpet was going to catch on fire! It burned my hand!!!! The steam was so hot that the lacquer on the dresser that was a few feet away, BUBBLES AND MELTED!!! I threw it in the TRASH!! This should be recalled!!! DO NOT BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the money; was rather inexpensive and I needed one to replace my old. Would recommend works well enough. Only issue I had was how long it initially took to start steaming; I thought it was broke because of the amount of time it took.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe&Randy

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase- squirts water!
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase. I will be returning. It seriously squirts out tons of water. I followed the manual EXACTLY... it is very loud.
customer_reviews.author: boricua_girl19

customer_reviews.title: Be careful unplugging it
customer_reviews.text: The only problem I have with this product is that there is no on/off button. When your done with it you just pull the cord out of the socket but sometimes it sparks when I do that which is dangerous and scary. Other than that I really like this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex k

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works ok... It does spit water everywhere though even when it's filled under the max fill line. I set it on top of a thick towel. It's also kinda hard to clean since the reservoir has about a half inch lip that traps the water when your dumping it out. So you have to fill and dump multiple times to get all the little black particles it makes out. I also have to use far more salt than the directions say but I think it's just the water quality where I live.. Not bad for the price but I think I will upgrade to a better quality one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: This is a total waste of time and money. Heats water - that's it. No steam - not even a sound. Such a crime to even sell this piece of crap. Shame on me for not testing it until I had an actual need for it. Now too too late to return it. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jaye Catalano

customer_reviews.title: Warning
customer_reviews.text: We will not be using this . Last night ours woke us up it smelled like burnt plastic . There was a lot of smoke and almost caught on fire .
customer_reviews.author: _hoezer

customer_reviews.title: Buy something better
customer_reviews.text: Its okay, I guess. It works, but only if you add a ton of salt. It also occasionally makes a strange noise when plugged in, and i've had it only for less than a month. Lastly, if the water isn't filled to the max line (or close to it), the product wont make steam. I'd recommend putting in an extra ten bucks and buying something worth keeping.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: A necessary evil
customer_reviews.text: I buy a new one every year to avoid black mold buildup in the motor. You can't really clean that part. It's worth it for me to buy a new on each year and go for these cheaper ones because you can't clean the big ones properly either
customer_reviews.author: Moki

customer_reviews.title: It's alright
customer_reviews.text: It boils out a lot quicker than I expected and the VapoSteam doesn't even last that whole time. It just smells like weird water after a while until it boils out. Also not as much steam as I hoped. But it did seem to help with my dry nose: my nosebleeds stopped almost immediately so it works in that aspect at least.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great during the winter season for warmth and humidity
customer_reviews.text: This works very well at putting out a warm steam that not only helps with humidity but also takes the chill out of the air I think. I just keep adding a jug of water and ours is very hard to the unit until it starts to sputter then I clean it all out and start over. Very pleased and it sure does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: SueS

customer_reviews.title: Defective & Low Glow Nightlight
customer_reviews.text: It doesnt work after while and the nightlight is not one bit credible for a nightlight. Its more like a "the chord is plugged on the power is on" Dont know if stopped working because I used tapwater and there's mineral deposit build up. Either way the directions dont specify distilled water.
customer_reviews.author: JujuMom

customer_reviews.title: As Expected
customer_reviews.text: I live in a home with natural gas heat and this humidifier adds moisture to the dry air. It also keeps the heat inside. This is my second purchase of this model. Simple to use; fill it with cold water, replace the top and plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: GsoGlenn

customer_reviews.title: this product says its made for med-small rooms and it ...
customer_reviews.text: this product says its made for med-small rooms and it is much more suited for smaller rooms. it says 12-18 hours of vapor and the more i use it the longer it seems to last over night (at first it didnt even last 8 hours-- yet it now will continue vapor for 12-15). the night light is very dim, which is okay for me but do not buy this product if you need a bight night light. Came with coupons so i am able to purchase vicks products to use with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kate McCall

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy I found this product but
customer_reviews.text: I love this product so much so happy I found it because it helps my dry eyes from my autoimmune deficiency syndrome and helps me get fewer colds but what I don’t like is that a lot of times I use it I have to put salt in it every time I use it just to get the steam to come out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: especially if you add a pinch of sea salt (sea salt is probably better than regular salt as it has more minerals so ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had any issues with this. Creates a lot of steam, especially if you add a pinch of sea salt (sea salt is probably better than regular salt as it has more minerals so will probably result in more steam). Great for this low price!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Hanna

customer_reviews.title: recommend
customer_reviews.text: It's my first time to buy this product through Amazon, but I used to use this product for every winter season. Sometime, when I put too much salt in it, there is some black peeled out things in the bowl, but it's not big deal. Just replace water that's it. Low price and make warm the air and keep humidity.
customer_reviews.author: Jaehyun Kim

customer_reviews.title: Fire Hazard!!
customer_reviews.text: I had this vaporizer for about a month. It worked on and off but not consistently. Then, one night while I was asleep with it on I awoke to the smell of something burning. I unplugged it and the smell went away. I hoped to return it but was unable to through Amazon due to their policy so I tried using it again, thinking maybe I overreacted to the smell. It blew my electrical circuits...twice. I wrote to the company and ultimately they refuse to refund, replace, or report it to their safety department.
customer_reviews.author: Heather renne

customer_reviews.title: Would be better if there were some way to turn it off
customer_reviews.text: Would be better if there were some way to turn it off. An on/off switch maybe? Nah, the only way to turn it off is to unplug it, or let the water run out. Or just pull the probe out of the water, I suppose. Also, I used this at night once and it made the room way too humid. My phone wouldn't turn on it got so wet, and it was on the other side of the room. Some way to regulate this would be nice....A dimmer switch perhaps? Good for the price. It's a plastic tub with an electrode. How can you mess that up?
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I used to have one of these and loved it, but something has really changed. I can't even smell the vicks. I have lupus and sjogrens and need something for moisture but I am really disappointed in these. I really feel like I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Rastamomma

customer_reviews.title: Not a good value.
customer_reviews.text: This humidifier doesn’t produce nearly as much steam as my cold mist humidifier does. It’s noisy and, although the tank seems large, it doesn’t last very long before shutting down.
customer_reviews.author: Patobi

customer_reviews.title: It works just needs better features.
customer_reviews.text: I wish tgis had an on/off button versus having to unplug. Also wish there was better way to fill the resoivoir. You have to be careful not to add to much as the filter will push water out the top if you accidentally overfill. It works ok. Just wisged for better features.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Product...I agree with Patrick on the reviews. Some people whine about this product it puts out too much steam, it doesn't put out enough steam.. This product works excellent, if you read the instructions. Not all water is the same.
customer_reviews.author: gibs

customer_reviews.title: Most bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: always my favorite I've had many different types of vaporizers were much more expensive I leave them on all the time for my plants this one is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Beshert

customer_reviews.title: It does what it's supposed to. I do notice ...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to. I do notice that there is some debris in the water that i empty out each day. I don't know where it's coming from, i would guess mineral build up except that it's black. Pro's: creates warm mist not too loud night light is not bright Con's: ugly does not have an auto shutoff feature, which i find usefull when running overnight. wierd debris in water, not sure if it's the water or vaporizer. no handle to hold by
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: So far, great buy
customer_reviews.text: I've had a cool air humidifier for a few years now, and it worked well but I remembered really liking the warm mist one my parents had when I was a kid. I like to put essential oils in the humidifier to make the house smell nice, and I couldn't do that in the cool air one. So far, this is working great! This humidifier is super quiet. The old one rattled and vibrated and burped. Unless the room is silent, or I stand really close to this one, I can't hear it at all. I bought an extra one to put in my office at work, and I might buy another to put in my upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: LindseyL

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one your mom had when you were little
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, it does make a gurgly noise but I like white noise to sleep to. I like the way it creates the warm steam, I've had it running in my bedroom for the past couple weeks. Adding the pinch of salt was a must for me, my water must not contain much mineral content and steam did not come out at first. Added that pinch of salt and presto.
customer_reviews.author: M. Twargowski

customer_reviews.title: Does not work. Added the "pinch of salt" as ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Added the "pinch of salt" as suggested if it does not steam. Nothing. I could not get to the store because I am sick with the flu. Was really looking forward to this delivery coming in two days.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Terrible vaporizer. Only uses two thirds of the water ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible vaporizer. Only uses two thirds of the water before you have to refill again; difficult to empty completely to get particles left in the water out. Does not generate enough mist to make any difference even in a small room. Wish I had not waited so long to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Dorsch

customer_reviews.title: Vicks steamer
customer_reviews.text: The unit would not run at first. I read the directions again and had to add salt to the water to get it to run. The unit spits and sputters a lot and the stream of steam is only a few inches. Not a lot of steam comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn F.

customer_reviews.title: Useless - stay away
customer_reviews.text: If you need a steam vaporizer, then please look further than this. This produces little steam (even after adding salt) & actually sprays out hot water from where steam is supposed to come out. Because it produces little steam you keep it close & because you keep it close, the hot water gets sprayed (hot enough to sting). I guess that's what 11 bucks gets you.
customer_reviews.author: Rawat Malhotra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Humidifier.
customer_reviews.text: This machine really helps to humidify the house during the winter. Simple to use & a good price. It will occasionally spit water out with the steam, so keep it on some sort of catch. We have a forced air system and this device keeps the relative humidity (RH) around 35%. We also use the battery powered Acu Rite RH meter to measure the results.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after less than a month
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after less than a month. Not sure why this product has such a short life now. I had my original one for 2-3 years, and recently they just don’t last as long, though when it works, I really enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Mulheren

customer_reviews.title: For the price consider this as something you use only for or one or two seasons...
customer_reviews.text: and you won't be disappointed and also will never have to clean it. With that kind of use, this is an excellent product that works just as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: mavern

customer_reviews.title: Excessive noise, low output
customer_reviews.text: Lousy machine, excessively noisy, almost no steam. Shuts down when half the container is used up. does not push aroma into the room for therapy breathing.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M. Hatin

customer_reviews.title: Good value, great use
customer_reviews.text: Had same one before . Awesome for cleaning nose during allergies or cold. Even good for face cleaning with steam. Kids friendly too. (6years old is now trained)
customer_reviews.author: hardik

customer_reviews.title: JUNK. WILL MAKE YOU FEEL EVEN SICKER TO WASTE $
customer_reviews.text: The Worst! Ridiculous. And it looked used when Amazon harnessed all its global resources to bring me a box with no wrapping...just sitting in my yard thrown over the fence for my dogs to pee on. And all 4 of them did. Thanks but no thanks amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of s@&$
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are educated and read the directions front to cover. The machine still does not work! We tried the Vick’s square inserts and when that didn’t work we tried the liquid. We added salt per the trouble shooting directions and it still does not work! Grr
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: works well, simple
customer_reviews.text: this is the best vaporizer. very simple, just heats the water and produces steam. keeps me from drying out in the winter months when the heat is on.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: I was able to get it to work just fine the first night by adding a little bit of ...
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get it to work just fine the first night by adding a little bit of salt. But even after it quite emitting water, there was a lot left over in the bottom of the tub. Unfortunately, on the second night it wreaked of burned plastic when I started running it. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ellenwood

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a no frills vaporizer, but that's what I wanted. It has two parts, the plastic base that holds the water and the top part that creates the steam. I got this to use in my child's room and it works great. Its also easy to clean and has the option of adding Vics products if you have a sick person needed a bit more breathing help. My only complaint is not with the product, but with the price. After I made my Amazon purchase I found it 40% cheaper at my local drug store, and it wasn't on sale. I could have bought it for cheaper, but it still works good and I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Will need maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money BUT be ready to clean out the oxidation when it starts to spit up water or starts to smell like burnt plastic.. But once you clean it, it’s. Good as newww
customer_reviews.author: R. V

customer_reviews.title: Trips the power during each use! It is unusable!
customer_reviews.text: That and it leaves weird black deposits within the vessel. Quite nasty. This is a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Benny and the Jets

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Colorado
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, great steam volume, great price. Suspect it will last about a year before required to be replaced, but this is expected for this type of vaporizer.
customer_reviews.author: CASMAN71

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Really a boost for winter indoor air. Very easy to use. Probably will need a bit of salt to get it going. I have never had one last as long as the 3 year warranty, even with excellent care. But this is still the best option for dry air. Very reasonable price for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dayna McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Great product,highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Works incredibly! Helping so much with sleeping for my little one with upper respiratory issues. Definately recommend. Love that you can use the vicks pads or liquid. Alot less messy with the pads.
customer_reviews.author: Mombxryn

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: GOt this a year ago when I was sick. It worked ok for a few weeks. Then this year it just stopped working. It hummed a bit and used up some water then it did noting over at least 5 days. I have tossed it. It is simple, but sort of a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: mwoel777

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Works like advertised. Have a few older models at home. This one has a slightly smaller reservoir. Not an issue though. Good for a 12 hour setting, overnight for a nights sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Had to add salt to water.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Base never got too hot, so didn’t have to worry where to put it. Had to add a little salt to water before it would work well.
customer_reviews.author: DJE

customer_reviews.title: Last longer than the most expensive humidifier, stop working even with distilled water.
customer_reviews.text: Just fill it up with regular water; some say it requires some salt; guess it all depends on your water source.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Beene

customer_reviews.title: ok but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I use one of these to humidify the air in the room where I sleep almost every nite of the year but the heating element cracks and fuses and after a few months quits heating the water sufficiently and I have to replace it. If it didn't have such a short life, I'd give more stars. ~same price as wal mart locally.
customer_reviews.author: Ficus

customer_reviews.text: Works well but doesn't last long enough. Either the mist is too great or not enough water storage. 6 hours max
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Worked twice
customer_reviews.text: Worked great two times then quit steaming. I can’t even return it because of the vapors and when I go to the manufacturing website I can’t contact them without calling.
customer_reviews.author: Bug

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: It works ok. It is a little noisy and I think works better with distilled water. I just started using and it looks burnt out already. Just ok for me
customer_reviews.author: Jocie loves to shop

customer_reviews.title: Good...while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Pro: good amount of steam (while it worked) when i used it nightly Cons: stopped working suddenly after less than six months, was difficult to clean, and due to the shape of the container i could not fill it in the bathroom sink (had to run the bath faucet or kitchen sink).
customer_reviews.author: AverageGummyBear

customer_reviews.title: Would have returned it if I was home to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have returned it if I was home to use it when it arived. The item barely steams even after adding the salt. I guess you can’t expect much for under $20
customer_reviews.author: James W

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product. The price is great, the size is small, the brand has a great reputation..... That being said, I cannot recommend it. Here's why: This machine needs salt in the water to work correctly... but no matter how much I tried to find the sweet spot for the mixture.... it just didn't happen. The top gets hot. Not warm. Not like a hot mug of coffee... HOT. Be very careful. My best advice... get an ultrasonic style vaporizer.
customer_reviews.author: Cuylar

customer_reviews.title: Hard water just kills it... but there’s a fix
customer_reviews.text: If you have hard water this’ll work for a few nights, then you’ll have to take it apart and scrape the salt and minerals off of the Todd. There are how to YouTube videos. Scraping takes 10 minutes compared to hours and gallons of vinegar soaks.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper#9

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: Honestly trash. does not work unless you put salt, and it tells you not to use salt too much. This is trash. Sit in a shower for free!
customer_reviews.author: bethany

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned unit or something.
customer_reviews.text: Just plugged in to use for the first time. Does not work. Only half of the nightlight lights up.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product several times to help my baby get better and sleep better throughout the night when she has a cold or a cough, and it has worked!! I bought it for this purpose and it worth it, we can breath better, the air gets a bit humid, just enough to make us confortable, I actually like to use it sometimes even when we feel ok. It works for the entire night, you just have to put the level of water it says and enough salt (a lot), mix it well and plug it. And the cleaning, I just clean it with water after every use. I recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana MdA

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Get's hot!
customer_reviews.text: My concern is that the tank and water get incredibly hot! I am afraid to leave it on over-night or if I should step out of the house.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. Absolutely love how well it helped with my sinuses. I think the instructions should a little clearer on what hard/soft water is.
customer_reviews.author: wms100684

customer_reviews.title: Okay...
customer_reviews.text: It's not strong enough to even smell the vapor vicks, but all else like cleaning it and noise level is good
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: An easy clean
customer_reviews.text: Love that this is both easy to use & easy to clean. I use the mist in the mornings & it seems to help.
customer_reviews.author: Msags

product_meta.title: Vicks Warm Steam Vaporizer with Nightlight, Vaporizer for Bedrooms, Baby, Kids Rooms, Auto-Shut Off, 1.5 Gallon Tank for Full Day of Moisturized Air, Use With Menthol Scented VapoPads & VapoSteam
product_meta.description: Vicks 1.5 Gallon Warm Steam Vaporizer with Night-Light.
feature_bullets: Warm Steam Vaporizer With Nightlight: This Vicks Vaporizer has a 1.5 Gallon tank for up to a full day of warm Mist Relief, Automatic Shut Off, and works with Vicks VapoPads so you get the soothing combination of Humidified Air and Vicks Menthol Scent

Vicks Vaporizer With Soothing Menthol: Ideal for a Small or Medium Bedroom or Nursery. Features Medicine Cup for Use With Vicks VapoSteam for Medicated Steam. Warm Steam Can Help Relieve & Calm Coughing & Congestion From Colds, the Flu, or Allergies.

Cough & Congestion Relief: When you or your kid has a cold, it can be difficult to sleep through the night. Humidifiers, vaporizers, & steam inhalers provide temporary relief from coughing & congestion, so your rest won't be as disturbed by coughing fits.

Vicks Vaporizers, Humidifiers, & Steam Inhalers: Steam & humidity offer temporary relief from cough & congestion due to colds or allergies. Vicks line of humidifiers & steam inhalers, help you breathe easier wherever you are, from the bedroom to office.
Humidifiers for Bedrooms, Desks, Tables: Our Humidifiers & Vaporizers Help You Breathe Better Wherever You are.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
